committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Education, Arts and Humanities

official_title: A bill to provide grants to States for fellowships for individuals who have outstanding ability, demonstrate an interest in a teaching career, and will teach in areas of the State where there is a shortage of quality elementary or secondary school teachers or in fields of study in which there is a shortage of quality elementary or secondary school teachers, or both, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Future Teacher Training Corps Act - Amends title V (Teacher Corps and Teacher Training Programs) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 to establish a new program of Future Teacher Training Corps Fellowships. Directs the Secretary of Education to allot program grant funds to each State on the basis of school-age population. Directs State Governors to appoint Selection Review Panels to select fellowship recipients according to specified guidelines. Requires that recipients be interested in teaching careers and agree to teach in areas of the State or in fields of study with a shortage of elementary or secondary school teachers. Limits each such fellowship to not more than: (1) $5,000 for each year of graduate education in preparation to become an elementary or secondary school teacher; and (2) two years of such graduate education. Authorizes appropriations for FY 1990 through 1992 to carry out this Act. Authorizes the Secretary to award up to 5,000 fellowships during each of those fiscal years.

titles.title: A bill to provide grants to States for fellowships for individuals who have outstanding ability, demonstrate an interest in a teaching career, and will teach in areas of the State where there is a shortage of quality elementary or secondary school teachers or in fields of study in which there is a shortage of quality elementary or secondary school teachers, or both, and for other purposes.
